description: Blood plasma exposure to hyperbolic field emitters

visual_description.scene: two test tubes on LED panel with backlighting from below, dark background
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottoms

plasma.notes: plasma is homogeneous, without visible clots or sediment; left test tube slightly darker than right; rounded meniscus shadows visible at bottom of both

visual_description.scene: one test tube on LED panel with backlighting from below, dark background
visual_description.view: macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: small air bubbles visible in lower part; plasma is homogeneous; rounded meniscus shadow at bottom

visual_description.scene: one test tube on LED panel with backlighting from below, dark background
visual_description.view: macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: plasma is homogeneous, without bubbles; rounded meniscus shadow visible at bottom; slightly more saturated color than 21.1.1

visual_description.scene: three test tubes on light surface (paper), held by hand
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, test tubes lying parallel

plasma.notes: rounded gelatinous clots (thrombi) visible at bottom of all three test tubes; clots are beige-yellowish in color; plasma around clots is transparent; label visible on bottom test tube; text on paper visible under test tubes

visual_description.scene: four test tubes on light surface (paper with protocol text)
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, test tubes lying parallel

plasma.notes: rounded gelatinous clot visible at bottom of each test tube; labels with markings: 0.1.2, 21.1.1, 19.1.1, 0.1 (partially visible); clots of unequal size; printed experiment protocol text visible under test tubes

photos.pdf_caption: 3 test tubes on a dark surface

visual_description.scene: three test tubes on dark textured surface
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, test tubes lying parallel

plasma.notes: rounded white-yellowish clots visible in all three test tubes; clots are compact, positioned at bottom; plasma around them appears transparent; dark background allows better visibility of clot contours

visual_description.scene: three test tubes on light surface, horizontal view
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, macro on clot area

plasma.notes: rounded gelatinous yellowish-beige clots visible in all three test tubes; clots are approximately equal in size; plasma around clots is transparent

visual_description.scene: three test tubes on light surface (paper), top view of bottom
visual_description.view: top view of test tube bottoms with labels

plasma.notes: beige-yellowish gelatinous clot visible at bottom of each test tube; labels with markings: 0.1.1, 19.1.1 (inverted), 21.1.1; clots are rounded; plasma level is low

visual_description.scene: three test tubes in hand, on dark surface background, vacutainers and blue glove visible in background
visual_description.view: vertical, view of test tube bottoms from below

plasma.notes: pronounced rounded yellow clot visible at bottom of each test tube; clots are bright yellow, contrasting well with transparent plasma above; labels 21.1.1 and 0.1.1 visible on left test tube; vacutainers with red caps visible in background

visual_description.scene: four test tubes on light surface (paper), horizontal
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, macro on clot area

plasma.notes: rounded gelatinous clots visible in all four test tubes; upper clot (19.1.1) is larger with visible whitish film; lower clots are more compact; plasma around them is transparent; text shows through under test tubes

visual_description.scene: three test tubes in hand on dark background
visual_description.view: vertical, view of test tube bottoms from below

plasma.notes: rounded gelatinous yellow clot visible at bottom of each test tube; plasma above clots is transparent; clot in middle test tube appears slightly less dense; plasma volume in test tubes is approximately equal

visual_description.scene: three test tubes on light surface, finger holding the top one
visual_description.view: horizontal side view, macro on clot area

plasma.notes: large rounded dark beige clots visible in all three test tubes; clots appear dense with sharply defined edges; plasma around them is transparent with slight yellowish tinge

visual_description.scene: three test tubes in hand on dark background, lit from below
visual_description.view: vertical, view of test tube bottoms from below

plasma.notes: rounded yellowish-whitish clot visible at bottom of each test tube; clots are compact, approximately equal in size; plasma above is transparent with yellowish tinge; plasma volume in all three test tubes is similar

notes.observation_day2: Photos IMG_3282-IMG_3288 taken on 2026-01-29 (~17:15-17:29) show samples after ~20h incubation
notes.morphology_notes: In dried drop clinical morphology: coarse large cells = loose fibrin; dense fine mesh = dense fibrin; pronounced edge = active protein transport to periphery. Tubes 2.1 â€” first samples 1.5 ml in vacuum tubes after 20 hours

visual_description.scene: Close-up of container with collected blood plasma, top view at an angle. Plasma is in a white plastic container (likely a lid or tray)
visual_description.view: top at an angle

plasma.notes: Homogeneous plasma without visible inclusions. Liquid is clear, uniform yellow color. Volume is significant -- visibly the pooled plasma before distribution into samples

visual_description.scene: Glass test tube with plasma, backlit against light. Test tube filled approximately 2/3
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Slight turbidity. Small condensation drops visible on test tube walls in upper part. Bottom marking visible through glass. No air bubbles observed. Liquid level clearly visible

visual_description.scene: Same test tube 19.2.1, different angle. Backlighting from behind, test tube slightly tilted
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Color is noticeably lighter than in previous photo -- likely different backlighting angle. Plasma appears homogeneous. Small drops on test tube walls above liquid level

visual_description.scene: Glass test tube with sample 19.2.2 against light. Liquid volume less than in 19.2.1 (1.0 ml vs 1.5 ml)
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Plasma is homogeneous. Clear meniscus visible on surface. Slight opalescence. Upper part of test tube with condensation drops

visual_description.scene: Control test tube 0.2.1 against light. Volume 1.5 ml
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Plasma visually resembles irradiated samples. Homogeneous, without stratification or sediment. Drops on walls in upper zone

visual_description.scene: Control test tube 0.2.2 against light. Volume 1.0 ml
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Plasma is homogeneous. Liquid level lower than in samples 2.1 (smaller volume). Dense golden color

visual_description.scene: Test tube with sample 21.2.1 (irradiation channel 21) against light. White film/clot visible on plasma surface
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Whitish film visible on plasma surface -- beginning of fibrin clot formation. This distinguishes this sample from control and from channel 19. The liquid itself under the film is homogeneous

visual_description.scene: Repeat shot of test tube 21.2.1, slightly different angle. Test tube tilted
visual_description.view: side at an angle, macro, against light

plasma.notes: At this angle the surface film is less noticeable. Test tube filled ~2/3. Single condensation drop on wall above liquid level

visual_description.scene: Test tube with sample 21.2.2 (irradiation channel 21, 1.0 ml) against light
visual_description.view: side, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Plasma appears homogeneous. Liquid level is low (1.0 ml). Clear meniscus. Minimal condensation on walls

visual_description.scene: Three glass test tubes side by side against light (1.5 ml samples -- series 2.1). Marking visible on left test tube. Test tubes held by hand
visual_description.view: side, group shot, against light

plasma.notes: Comparative shot of three test tubes. Liquid levels approximately equal. Color and transparency visually indistinguishable between test tubes. Whitish film visible on surface of middle test tube

visual_description.scene: Three test tubes of series 2.1 (1.5 ml) against light: 19.2.1, 0.2.1, 21.2.1. More distant angle, test tubes fully visible
visual_description.view: side, group shot, against light

plasma.color: yellow-olive, identical in all three test tubes
plasma.notes: Visually all three samples are indistinguishable by color and transparency. Liquid levels match. Marking visible on left test tube. Marking also visible on right test tube

visual_description.scene: Three test tubes of series 2.1 close-up from below against light. Lower part of test tubes with plasma clearly visible
visual_description.view: side from below, group shot, macro, against light

plasma.notes: Plasma is homogeneous in all test tubes. Marking visible on left and right test tubes. Middle test tube has whitish film on surface. Condensation droplets on walls. Color of all three visually matches

visual_description.scene: Three test tubes of series 2.2 (1.0 ml) against light: 19.2.2, 0.2.2, 21.2.2. Test tubes held by hand
visual_description.view: side, group shot, against light

plasma.notes: Smaller liquid volume compared to series 2.1. Levels in all three are approximately equal. No visual differences between control and irradiated samples. Markings on test tubes visible

visual_description.scene: Bottom of test tube 19.2.2 tilted -- view through bottom. Plasma poured onto glass, visible as a drop on dark surface
visual_description.view: through bottom of tilted test tube, macro

plasma.notes: Plasma poured from test tube forming a drop on surface (likely a slide or Petri dish). A denser yellowish clot visible in center of drop, surrounded by transparent serous zone. Beginning of gelation process

visual_description.scene: Control sample 0.2.2 poured onto glass. Top-side view, plasma drop on dark surface
visual_description.view: top-side, macro

plasma.notes: Plasma drop on dark surface. Dense round yellow clot in center, surrounded by more transparent serous zone. Drop shape is teardrop-like. Clot is compact, well-formed

visual_description.scene: Sample 21.2.2 poured onto glass. Plasma drop on dark surface, top view
visual_description.view: top, macro

plasma.notes: Plasma drop larger than previous ones. Yellowish clot in center. Serous zone around clot is extensive, transparent. Drop shape is more elongated. Several small air bubbles in central zone

visual_description.scene: Petri dish with three plasma drops of series 2.1 (1.5 ml). Drops positioned at edges of dish. Caption: left 21, right 19, bottom 0. Immediately after application
visual_description.view: top, general view

plasma.notes: Three plasma drops applied to Petri dish. Drops are still liquid, just applied. Drop shape is teardrop-like, spread across surface. Petri dish is glass with green rim. Background is dark surface

visual_description.scene: Same Petri dish with three drops after ~6 hours of incubation. Reflection of hand and phone visible in glass
visual_description.view: top, general view

plasma.color: yellow-golden in center, whitish at edges
plasma.notes: Drops have started drying. Fibrin structure formation visible -- drop edges have become whitish/turbid, yellow liquid component remains in center. Initial crystallization phase. Upper left drop (21) is elongated. All three drops have visually changed compared to initial state

visual_description.scene: Petri dish after ~20 hours of incubation. Three dried drops with pronounced crystallization. General top view
visual_description.view: top, general view

plasma.color: yellow-brown in center, gray-white at periphery
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours. Drops have completely dried. Dried drop morphology is clearly visible: pronounced peripheral belt (edge zone) with fibrin structures and central zone with residual yellow plasma. Upper left drop (channel 21) -- elongated, with large cells. Upper right (channel 19) -- more rounded with fine-celled structure. Lower (control 0) -- with pronounced peripheral zone

visual_description.scene: Macro shot of one of the dried drops in a Petri dish (~20 hours). Detailed view of fibrin crystallization
visual_description.view: top, macro, close-up

plasma.color: yellow-olive in center, gray at periphery
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours. Dried drop. Peripheral zone -- wide belt of large elongated fibrin cells (loose fibrin). Cells are elongated, oriented perpendicular to drop edge. Dark rounded inclusions (vacuoles or bubbles) visible in cells. Central zone -- fine-celled network (dense fibrin) with residual yellow plasma. Transition zone between center and edge is clearly defined. Radial cracks from center to edge

visual_description.scene: Close-up of dried drop of sample 19.2.1 (channel 19) after ~20 hours of incubation
visual_description.view: top, macro, detailed

plasma.color: gray-greenish at periphery, yellow in center
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours, dried drop, sample channel 19. Pronounced edge zone with fibrin crystallization pattern. Peripheral belt contains: (1) chain of dark rounded vacuoles along inner edge, (2) radial cracks/grooves from center to edge, (3) fine crack network between large radial ones. Central zone -- residual yellow plasma, partially dried, with fine cracks. Transition between zones is sharp. Drop edge is smooth

visual_description.scene: Close-up of dried drop of sample 21.2.1 (channel 21) after ~20 hours of incubation
visual_description.view: top, macro, detailed

plasma.color: yellow-olive in center, gray-greenish at periphery
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours, dried drop, sample channel 21. Morphology differs from channel 19: (1) peripheral belt is wider, with large elongated fibrin cells, (2) cells contain dark rounded inclusions/vacuoles positioned along inner edge, (3) central zone -- yellow clot with less pronounced crack network, more amorphous. Radial cracks less pronounced than in channel 19. Central zone surface is smoother. Drop is elongated in shape

visual_description.scene: Control sample 0.2.1 test tube in hand after ~20 hours of incubation. Side view. Daylight
visual_description.view: side, macro, daylight

plasma.color: pale yellow, nearly colorless on top, yellow clot at bottom
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours. Pronounced stratification occurred in test tube: transparent pale serum on top, dense yellow fibrin clot on bottom. Clot has separated from walls, transparent liquid visible between clot and walls. Upper clot boundary is uneven with protrusions. Clot volume is approximately 1/3 of total volume

visual_description.scene: Control sample 0.2.1 test tube in hand, different angle. Clot retraction visible
visual_description.view: side, macro, daylight

plasma.color: pale yellow on top, saturated yellow clot at bottom
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours. Clear clot retraction: dense yellow fibrin clot at bottom, surrounded by transparent serum. Clot boundary is sharp, whitish dense membrane along upper edge. Clot is compact, retracted from walls. Petri dish with dried drops visible in background

visual_description.scene: Sample 19.2.1 (channel 19) test tube in hand after ~20 hours of incubation
visual_description.view: side, macro, daylight

plasma.color: pale yellow on top, yellow clot with whitish membrane at bottom
plasma.notes: Phase ~20 hours. Similar clot retraction pattern: dense yellow clot at bottom of test tube, transparent serum on top. Whitish fibrin membrane on clot surface. Clot is visually similar in size and density to control (0.2.1). Petri dish and other test tubes visible blurred in background

protocol.samples_note: plasma samples coagulated quickly, initial clots visible already from the pour

plasma.notes: plasma is homogeneous, without visible clots; meniscus clearly visible at upper edge of liquid

visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom at an angle

plasma.notes: white crescent-shaped fibrin clot visible at bottom; more saturated yellow zone in center -- possibly a forming dense clot

visual_description.scene: test tube against LED panel, dark background on sides
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom, frontal angle

plasma.notes: large amorphous irregularly shaped clots visible inside plasma; plasma is heterogeneous, turbidity in lower part

plasma.notes: yellow lumpy clots visible in central part; plasma is stratified -- more transparent at edges, dense inclusions in center

visual_description.scene: macro photography of test tube bottom, lighting from above
visual_description.view: macro, extreme close-up of bottom

plasma.notes: large irregularly shaped yellowish clot visible; nearby -- orange inclusion (likely dense fibrin clot); thread-like structures at edges

visual_description.scene: test tube against LED panel, dark background
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom, frontal angle

plasma.notes: plasma appears relatively homogeneous; several small air bubbles near wall in upper part

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand, backlighting from behind
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom, slightly tilted

plasma.notes: plasma is turbid, heterogeneous; clots visible in upper part; small air bubbles near wall

visual_description.scene: top view of test tube bottom, dark textured background
visual_description.view: top view, macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: white ring-shaped fibrin clot visible on surface; plasma is heterogeneous with thread-like structure across entire bottom area

visual_description.scene: top view of test tube bottom, dark background, side lighting
visual_description.view: top view, macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: loose yellow clot with thread-like structure visible in center; more transparent zone with whitish haze at edges

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel, top view of bottom
visual_description.view: top view, close-up of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: large dense brownish clot at center of bottom; transparent yellowish serum around it; clot with uneven surface, dark inclusions

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand, backlighting from behind
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom, slightly tilted

plasma.notes: plasma is turbid with thread-like structures; thin whitish fibrin fibers visible, distributed throughout volume

visual_description.scene: extreme macro of plasma surface through test tube glass
visual_description.view: macro, maximum magnification

plasma.notes: thin thread-like structures (fibrin fibers) visible within plasma; texture is heterogeneous

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel, top view of bottom
visual_description.view: top view, close-up of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: flat gelatinous clot with thread-like folds visible at bottom; clot occupies most of bottom; transparent serum at edges

visual_description.scene: top view of test tube bottom, dark textured background
visual_description.view: top view, macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: large irregularly shaped yellow clot in center; white fragment visible (likely dense fibrin strand); thread-like structures around clot; small air bubbles

visual_description.scene: top view of test tube bottom, dark background
visual_description.view: top view, macro of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: dense yellow clot in center; surrounded by translucent zone with thread-like structures; small air bubbles

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel, top view of bottom
visual_description.view: top view, close-up of test tube bottom

plasma.notes: large dark brown dense clot at center of bottom; light slightly turbid serum around it; small air bubbles visible; clot is notably darker than in other samples

visual_description.scene: test tube on light illuminated surface, top view through open end
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom from above

plasma.color: light yellow with darker zone in center
plasma.notes: dark amorphous formation visible at center of bottom -- presumably clot or sediment; plasma is lighter and more transparent at edges; marking visible on test tube wall at upper right

visual_description.scene: test tube on light illuminated surface, top view through open end
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom from above

plasma.color: light yellow with olive tinge in central part
plasma.notes: loose dark mass visible at center of bottom -- clot/sediment occupying significant part of bottom; test tube edges are white (plastic); plasma around clot is more transparent

visual_description.scene: test tube on light illuminated surface, top view through open end
visual_description.view: close-up of test tube bottom from above

plasma.notes: plasma appears more homogeneous compared to other samples; bottom is clean, without pronounced clots; thin linear structures barely visible at bottom; overall appearance significantly more transparent than previous samples

visual_description.scene: three test tubes lying horizontally on LED panel (white backlighting), side view
visual_description.view: general side view, three test tubes parallel

plasma.notes: light rounded clots/sediment visible at bottom (rounded part) of all three test tubes; upper test tube (21.4.1) -- sediment less pronounced; middle (0.4.1) and lower (19.4.1) -- sediment more noticeable and larger; marking visible on middle test tube; lower test tube also has marking; air bubbles visible on walls of middle and lower test tubes

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel (white backlight strip), side view
visual_description.view: frontal view of lower half of test tube

plasma.notes: dark zone visible in lower part of test tube -- sediment or clot; plasma fills test tube approximately halfway; marking visible at bottom; meniscus clearly visible at top

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand on dark background, side view
visual_description.view: side close-up, test tube tilted

plasma.notes: plasma shifted to one edge due to tilt; whitish meniscus/film visible on surface; small inclusions visible within plasma volume; test tube walls are transparent

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand on dark background, macro photography
visual_description.view: side close-up of lower part of test tube

plasma.notes: large whitish clot/film clearly visible in upper part of liquid; clot has loose fibrous structure; plasma below is more transparent and yellow; pronounced stratification -- turbid top and more transparent bottom

visual_description.scene: Petri dish on dark textured surface, top view
visual_description.view: top view of Petri dish

plasma.notes: large translucent rounded gelatinous clot visible in Petri dish; clot occupies most of the dish; liquid fraction visible at clot edges; glare and small air bubbles noticeable on clot surface; edges of other test tubes visible nearby

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel (white backlight strip), side view
visual_description.view: frontal view of lower half of test tube

plasma.notes: darker zone visible in central and lower part -- sediment; compared to IMG_3312 the dark zone appears more pronounced; small bubbles visible on meniscus surface; test tube fill level similar

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand on dark background, macro photography
visual_description.view: side close-up of lower part of test tube

plasma.notes: large whitish/milky clot clearly visible, occupying central part of test tube; clot has dense rounded shape with fibrous edges; plasma around clot is more transparent; upper part of liquid is hazy

visual_description.scene: Petri dish on dark textured surface, top view
visual_description.view: top view of Petri dish

plasma.notes: large teardrop-shaped gelatinous clot visible in dish; clot is translucent with whitish areas; glare visible on surface; liquid plasma fraction at edges; edges of test tubes visible nearby; textured dark surface under dish

visual_description.scene: test tube held by hand, backlit by LED panel from behind
visual_description.view: side close-up of lower part of test tube

plasma.notes: large whitish fibrous clot visible in upper part of liquid; clot is less dense than in other test tubes -- more loose and distributed; lower part of plasma is more transparent and yellow; thin thread-like structures visible in volume

visual_description.scene: test tube on LED panel (white backlight strip), side view
visual_description.view: frontal view of lower half of test tube

plasma.notes: plasma is more saturated yellow compared to other samples; dark sediment zone visible in lower part; meniscus clearly visible; small bubbles on surface; overall fill volume similar to other test tubes

visual_description.scene: Petri dish on dark textured surface, top view
visual_description.view: top view of Petri dish

plasma.notes: large translucent rounded gelatinous clot visible in dish; clot is denser and whiter than sample 19.5.1; whitish fibrous structures on clot surface; liquid fraction at edges; edges of other test tubes visible nearby; overall clot size comparable to previous samples

visual_description.scene: two test tubes held by hand on dark background, horizontal position
visual_description.view: top view of lying test tubes, close-up of bottom part

plasma.color: transparent with yellowish tinge; clots from pale yellow to orange
plasma.notes: compact rounded clots visible at bottom of both test tubes; left test tube (21.6.2) -- clot is smaller, pale yellow/cream, more loose; right test tube (19.6.2) -- clot is larger, with pronounced orange-brown center and light periphery; liquid fraction in both test tubes is nearly transparent; dark equipment visible in background

visual_description.scene: six test tubes lying horizontally parallel to each other on light surface
visual_description.view: general top view, all six samples visible

plasma.color: from transparent to pale yellow; clots from whitish to orange
plasma.notes: clots of various sizes and colors visible in all six test tubes; top (21.6.2) -- small light clot; second (0.6.2) -- whitish scattered inclusions; third (19.6.2) -- large clot with orange center; fourth (21.6.1) -- small whitish inclusions; fifth (0.6.1) -- small pale clot; sixth (19.6.1) -- small yellowish clot; liquid fraction in all test tubes is nearly transparent; glass test tubes, no marking on visible side

visual_description.scene: three test tubes held by hand on dark background, spotlight from the left
visual_description.view: side view at an angle, test tubes slightly tilted

plasma.notes: left test tube (21.6.1) -- plasma is yellow, small whitish clots/sediment visible at bottom, least filled; middle (0.6.1) -- plasma is yellow, medium-sized whitish clot visible within liquid; right (19.6.1) -- plasma is more saturated yellow, rounded compact yellowish clot visible; all test tubes are glass; white label visible at bottom of left test tube; point light source (flashlight) creates glare and overexposure on the left

visual_description.scene: Two glass test tubes with plasma close-up on dark background, illuminated from the side
visual_description.view: frontal, lower part of test tubes

plasma.notes: A large irregularly shaped gelatinous clot is visible in the left test tube. The right test tube has more homogeneous plasma, but slight turbidity is also visible

visual_description.scene: Two glass test tubes with plasma, vertical, on gray background
visual_description.view: frontal, full length of test tubes

plasma.notes: Rounded gelatinous clots visible in both test tubes. Left test tube (19.7.1) -- clot is compact, closer to the bottom. Right (21.7.1) -- clot is larger, positioned slightly higher. Plasma volume is small

visual_description.scene: One glass test tube with plasma, held vertically, laboratory setting in background
visual_description.view: frontal, lower part of test tube

plasma.notes: Large dense irregularly shaped clot visible in lower part of test tube. Small bubbles and condensation drops noticeable on test tube walls

visual_description.scene: Test tube with plasma close-up, tilted, against backlighting

plasma.notes: Large gelatinous clot occupies significant portion of volume. Clot is heterogeneous, with darker center and lighter edges. Gelatinous texture is clearly visible

visual_description.view: frontal with slight tilt

plasma.notes: Rounded clot visible in middle part of test tube. Pipette visible next to test tube. Clot is compact, clearly stands out against transparent plasma

visual_description.view: top view, into test tube

plasma.notes: Large dense clot visible inside plasma. Plasma is bright yellow. Small light area visible at bottom of test tube -- possibly sedimentation

plasma.notes: Compact rounded clot visible in center of volume. Plasma surrounds the clot, clear boundary between clot and liquid part is visible

visual_description.view: macro, side, horizontal

plasma.notes: Irregularly shaped clot with wavy contours visible. Small bubbles on liquid surface. Clot texture is heterogeneous

visual_description.scene: Three test tubes with plasma, held vertically by hand, against backlighting
visual_description.view: frontal, bottom part of test tubes, from below

plasma.notes: Clots visible in all three test tubes. Left -- clot is compact. Middle -- clot is larger, with darker center. Right -- clot is lighter and more diffuse. Plasma volume varies

visual_description.scene: Three test tubes with plasma, held vertically by hand, against backlighting
visual_description.view: frontal, lower part of test tubes

plasma.notes: Clots visible in all three test tubes. Marking visible on middle test tube. Clots differ in size -- middle is the largest. Right test tube has air bubble near wall

visual_description.scene: Four test tubes with plasma arranged horizontally in pairs (two on top, two on bottom), held by hand, against backlighting
visual_description.view: macro, side, horizontal, pairwise arrangement

plasma.notes: Clots of different sizes visible in all four test tubes. Upper left -- clot is compact. Upper right -- clot is larger. Lower test tubes also contain clots. Air bubble visible near lower right test tube

visual_description.scene: Two test tubes with plasma close-up, bottom part, dark background
visual_description.view: frontal from below, close-up of bottom part

plasma.notes: Both test tubes contain significant plasma volume. Clots visible in both. Plasma has more saturated color compared to earlier photos -- possibly time has passed since irradiation

visual_description.scene: Two test tubes with plasma in horizontal position, one above the other, with backlighting from behind
visual_description.view: side, horizontal, test tubes parallel

plasma.notes: Rounded clots visible in both test tubes. Upper test tube -- clot is brighter and more compact. Lower -- clot is larger and paler. Condensation drops visible on walls

visual_description.scene: Two test tubes with plasma in horizontal position, one above the other, against backlighting
visual_description.view: side, horizontal, macro

plasma.notes: Upper test tube -- clot is compact, rounded, with sharp contours. Lower -- clot is smaller, paler. Difference in clot sizes between test tubes is visible

visual_description.scene: Two test tubes with plasma in horizontal position, one above the other, held by hand, against backlighting
visual_description.view: side, horizontal, macro

plasma.notes: Clots visible in both test tubes. Upper test tube (21) -- clot is larger, rounded, with sharp contours. Lower (19) -- clot is smaller, paler. Difference in clot formation intensity between samples 19 and 21 is visible
